fields.description:
The silver-white design scheme is pretty and elegant, but terrible to use. It provides no contrast, and tabs are hardly noticeable. Without focusing hard I cannot find a thing anymore.

The ability to customize the look and feel of the JIRA more or even the ability to use themes would be a great addition.
fields.summary: More Control of Look And Feel, Theme Support

fields.description: The sizing of headings is inconsistent, e.g. an h4 which always was quite small is suddenly quite large. This may be a consequence of the overall larger font, and isn't really a big deal.
fields.summary: Heading sizes in Issue View are inconsistent

fields.description: There is way more wasted space in the new interface than before. Too much whitespace, too much scrolling.
fields.summary: Too much whitespace in issue view screem

fields.description: The top section with the issue's key properties used to stand out visibly, this really helped in locating each of these properties (they were bolded). Now it blends in completely with the issue description - this is most visible when you switch to the "release notes" tab - you can hardly see where the release notes end and the description begins. It can be very difficult to find different areas of the issue such as *Environment*
fields.summary: Top Section of Issue View hard to read

fields.description: Visual separation between comments is important. There is a very slight silver-grey line between them, this needs to be more visible. The hover-effect however helps.
fields.summary: Visual Separation between comments

fields.description: Ideally there should be quick-nav anchor-based links to get to each of the above from the very top of the issue. There also should be keyboard shortcuts for these. While you can temporarily fold away the description, you can't do the same with the "Issue" section (what formerly used to be a grey panel).
fields.summary: Quick Nav Anchor Links

fields.description:
This is feedback from a customer at Atlascamp. They set up their JIRA workflow to have steps after Resolved (for QA etc), but then found that some parts of JIRA assume that Resolved is the last step (for example some gadgets) and don't show issues past that step. 

I mentioned that at Atlassian we generally add new steps before Resolved, but that they could make gadgets that display custom filters to include issues past Resolved. The customer said he wished the docs would have warned him about the assumptions JIRA makes before he went down the path of creating more workflow steps after Resolved. This might be useful not only in the docs but as in-product documentation at the point the user is about to make a step after Resolved.
fields.summary: Make clear in docs that Resolved state should probably be last
JIRA Needs an Append-Only Field or Permission
The 'user created' event is not thrown when JIRA is configured to use external user management

fields.description:
There must be a way to configure the Activity stream date format.
http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-19329
https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/browse/STRM-167
Thanks
Lena
fields.summary: Activity stream date format configuration

fields.description:
We now have 60 Jira projects. It seems we often are scanning the list to pick out a project. There needs to be a hierarchy such that a person can view a subset of all existing projects. Jira has categories, which I assign, but I don't see a way to use the categories to filter my view of projects. This should be simple and straight forward as users with low Jira experience will be doing this often.

Additionally, several of our 60 projects are no longer active. I do not want to delelte them, because the issue logs contain useful information. Being able to disable/archive a project so it does not show up in the long project lists would also be useful.
fields.summary: Long list of projects

fields.description:
Time displayed in AM//PM format in Activity Stream.

Settings in Administration -> Global Settings -> Look and Feel -> Date/Time Formats:
  Time Format 	HH:mm 	08:00
  Day Format 	EEEE HH:mm 	Wednesday 08:00
  Complete Date/Time Format 	dd.MMM.yy HH:mm 	20.Oct.10 08:00
  Day/Month/Year Format 	dd.MM.yyyy 	20.10.2010
  Date Picker Format (javascript format) 	d/MMM/yy (%e/%b/%y) 	20/Oct/10
  Date Time Picker Format (javascript format) 	dd/MMM/yy h:mm a (%e/%b/%y %I:%M %p) 	20/Oct/10 8:00 AM
  Use ISO8601 standard in Date Picker 	ON

According to settings time should be displayed in 24h format only.
fields.summary: Time in AM/PM format in Activity Stream
Custom field names with trailing white space should get matched by the project importer

fields.description:
When an issue becomes heavily commented, as the comments are all on one page, it becomes difficult to scroll the page.

---- 8< ---- ORIGINAL COMMENT ---- 8< ----

"UIが使いにくい。ページ遷移のリンクが右上にしかないため、毎回上まで戻らないといけない。
すべてのコメントが1画面に表示されるので、コメント数が多くなると画面スクロールが大変。"
fields.summary: Comment-heavy issue details page is hard to scroll

fields.description: The bypass feature was added under JIRA-7903. That issue also suggests that a "proper fix" would be to send mail "on a separate thread which can be timed out".
fields.summary: Sending mails on a separate thread which can be timed out to avoid the mail queue from getting clogged

fields.description: Sometimes it is needed to reuse the same email content. It would be good to have an email template to choose from, so when you are emailing an issue you can either write a message or choose from a dropdown menu a stock response.
fields.summary: Add the ability to reuse e-mail content
Add support for personal labels on issues

fields.description:
The current list of subtasks in a task/story is:
1) Sequence number
2) Story summary
3) Jira type icon
4) Resolution icon
5) Resolution description
6) Assignee
7) % complete
8) Progress bar

add to this list the version/iteration the subtask is allocated in.
fields.summary: Display the version/iteration information in the sub-tasks list of a story/task

fields.description: In the new interface it gert difficult to look at the sub-tasks as you need to scroll down the page. WOuld be great to have the subtasks on its own tab
fields.summary: Sub-Tasks TAb

fields.description:
I am hoping you would consider to implement a new function in JQL. The intent is to be able to search for issues where fixversion's *release date* is/is not defined. 

The goal of the function is to create a search of issues among multiple projects to find all issues which has been scheduled, hence they are the *active* issues. It would be an alternative to creating a filter based on fixVersion name, which would required a lot of updating.

I also see there may be issues with greenhopper parent-child versioning, but am not sure how is should be handeled...
fields.summary: Additional function in JQL; ability to search issues where fixVersion has a release date or not
This is a new SOAP issue 10/19/2010 11:15:43 AM
This is a new SOAP issue 10/19/2010 11:15:11 AM
This is a new SOAP issue 10/19/2010 11:15:01 AM
Source Patches for XSS/XSRF vulnerabilities

fields.description:
Today, to count how many users are associated to a specific project you must:
# Go to _Administration > Project > Projects_ and click on the project name, then in the _Project Team_ section click on the _View Members_ link.
# To all roles listed, count the single users listed on the _Users_ column and take note of the Groups names.
# Go to _Administration > Users, Groups & Roles > Group Browser_ and, on the _Users_ column, count how many users belong to a certain group associated with a certain role.

The amount of users associated with the project will be a count of single users + the amount of users that belong to each group.
The user must also pay attention because a single user can be associated with more then one group. He won't want to count the same user twice or more.

It would be great if the amount of members associated to each project were displayed in the Administration page where all projects are listed.

Please let me know if you need further explanation.

Regards,
____________________
Felipe Kraemer
Atlassian Support
fields.summary: Administration screen should display the amount of users associated to the project
Sort comments arrow direction
This is a new SOAP issue 10/18/2010 4:45:42 PM
This is a new SOAP issue 10/18/2010 4:33:37 PM
This is a new SOAP issue 10/18/2010 2:49:50 PM

fields.description: We want the "Isssue attributes" menu above the "Text Search" menu.
fields.summary: Change configuration of filter screen in jira issue navigator

fields.description:
If a summary, for example, contains "some.text.here" (double quotes included), it is not possible to search based on this using JQL in 4.0.2 or 4.1.1.

No combination of character escaping works, either.

This problem does not exist in JIRA 4.1.2.

Please see the screenshots attached for a demonstration.

This is rather trivial. However, having not found a previous report, it is important to document this for future reference.
fields.summary: Double Quotes Enclosing Period(s) in JQL Query Does Not Return Results

fields.description:
Not sure of standalone/app server
Not sure about JDK either
On the client side at least I am running Mac OS X Server 10.6.4

When I do a text search on the string "ecoe", in the results I get a bug
that only has "Eco" in the description; there is no place where the string
with the full four characters appears, just the substring which should not match.
fields.summary: When I search for the string "ecoe" in a bug description, it is returning a hit on the string "Eco"

fields.description:
The following documentation is slightly misleading:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Performing+Text+Searches#PerformingTextSearches-EscapingSpecialCharacters%3A%5C
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Performing+Text+Searches#PerformingTextSearches-QueryTerms
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Advanced+Searching#AdvancedSearching-ReservedCharacters

Basically, the docs suggest that you can search for a quotation character. However, in practice, Lucene's stemming strips quotes from words, so you don't need to specify a quote. Also, it's not actually searching for the quote.

Try this:

# Create a simple search {{chalk cheese}}. It matches both {{chalk}} OR {{cheese}}.
# Add quotes around it. It now matches the exact phrase {{chalk cheese}}.
# Switch to Advanced search. Notice the two sets of quotes. The _outer_ quotes are grouping the search term so JQL doesn't get confused. The _inner_ quotes, the escaped ones, are specifying an exact string match (creating a 'phrase' in our terminology).

So, actually, you can't escape a quotes character.

Usually I'd do a docs fix myself, but in this case I think it's worth discussing with a developer to find the expected behavior and document it based on that. Note the related bug report JRA-21047.
fields.summary: Improve searching docs re: quotation marks

fields.description:
We have two groups of users, and two permission schemes with different groupings of projects.  A User in group A can only view projects with Permission Scheme A.  A user in Group B can only view projects with Permission Scheme B.

If I (belonging to both permission schemes) link an issue in a project from Permission Scheme A (we'll call this projectA), to an issue in a project assigned to Permission Scheme B (we'll call this project B), a user solely in one of those permission schemes does not see the link on the View Issue page.  However, they do see a note saying "Bridget M changed the Link to 'This issue depends on PROJECTB-14' on PROJECTA-157 (Create Bug Lookup Tool)" in their activity stream.  I would imagine that because they can't see it on the issue face, they shouldn't see it in the activity stream either.

Also, I want to bring up, for the (JRA-2364) issue, this is one of the areas that shows time tracking information still, despite the hack.  If I knew how to block the time tracking stuff, I could hack our source files again to accommodate the time tracking changes.
fields.summary: Activity Stream shows linking to issues that the user doesn't have access to

fields.description:
Today, the only issue types that can be children of a parent issue are Sub-task and Technical Task.  Even though I'm free to create custom sub-task types, this is still to limiting. Use case:

I have an issue that requires fixing two bugs, implementing and enhancement, and creating some documentation. I would like to create a parent issue to reflect the main issue and 4 child issues: 2 Bugs, 1 Enhancement, 1 Documentation. Yes, I could create custom sub-task types (Bug sub-task, Enhancement sub-task, Documentation sub-task), but this would end up dirtying the database with too many types.

Further, I might want to show a Workload Report in order to report how many bugs, enhancements, and documentation hours are allocated to members of the team.  Displaying hours allocated to an issue type called "Sub-task" tells you nothing.  If I added a bunch of new sub-task types, I'd have to mentally add up the types (Bugs + Bug-subtask, Enhancement + Enhancement subtask, etc.).

What I really want is to allow those main types (Bug, Enhancement, Documentation) to be either parents or children.
fields.summary: Allow any issue type to be a child of a parent issue

fields.description: In our development departments we have a product owners who is handling all incoming features request and a service managers who is handling all incoming defects in JIRA. It would be great if it in a future JIRA release would be possible to set a default assignee for each issue type.
fields.summary: Ability to set default assignee on issue type

fields.description:
Our documentation on [writing integration tests for JIRA|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DEVNET/Plugin+Tutorial+-+Writing+Integration+Tests+for+your+JIRA+plugin] links to the javadocs for our functional test framework:

http://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/latest/func-test-javadoc/com/atlassian/jira/functest/framework/package-summary.html
http://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/latest/func-test-javadoc/

Both of those links don't work. Apparently the "latest" tree doesn't point to anything.  Hacking the URL to point to a specific version seems to work:

http://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/4.1/func-test-javadoc/com/atlassian/jira/functest/framework/package-summary.html
fields.summary: Generate missing "latest" functional test javadocs
Printable Version Roadmap report

fields.description:
Unable to turn OFF 'Allow unassigned issues' in General configuration, 
{noformat}
Cannot turn off "Allow unassigned issues" as there are 31 issue(s) that are unassigned.
Please assign these issues before disabling Unassigned Issues.
N.B. You may not have permissions to view all of these issues 
{noformat}

Problem : field 'assignee' has been hide on certain screen

Workaround : 
   1.  Go to Jira Administrator > Field configurations > Decision Configuration & News Configuration > Configure, show the assignee field.
   2. Re-index Jira
   3. Then you should be able to view the unassigned issues in General configuration
   4. Bulk edit to assign those issues
   5. Turn OFF 'Allow Unassigned Issues' in General configuration

Suggestion : to have better handling on such case instead of spending time to fill in virtual assignee to the issues.
fields.summary: Better handling on allow unassigned issues

fields.description: http://screencast.com/t/jU9lsiW5Zsc

* Components

Does not seem to affect labels.

!http://img.skitch.com/20101015-kmm2fpjgdu135yya63hpgy8eq9.jpg!
fields.summary: Frother control tooltips have whitespace

fields.description:
With so many plugin options and ways to use JIRA, its now annoying having various projects in JIRA for use for different applications. We have bug tracking projects (good ole JIRA) and now with Greenhopper, we have new projects which we want to see different fields in the Issue Navigator.

It would be good if...
1. JIRA still had a default "Issue Navigator" configuration, but
2. Individual projects could configure the Issue Navigator columns differently.
fields.summary: Configure Issue Navigator columns separately for different projects

fields.description:
When importing from CSV file you are able to create a new custom field that is multi select and separate the multiple items with a comma but if you try to do it with an existing multi select field only the first item in the list is imported.
i.e. 
{code}
Summary,Issue Type,Section
Something,Bug,"A,B,C"
Something2,Improvement,"A,C"
Something2,Improvement,"B"
{code}

Section is a Custom Field that is multi select.
When importing you get new issues created with this data:

Something,Bug,A
Something2,Improvement,A
Something2,Improvement,B
fields.summary: Importing from CSV does not properly allow mapping of existing multi-select custom fields

Could one of the developers look to see if the Pluck CSS is overriding the Delicious Byte CSS?  This is one theory as to why we are unable to edit the HTML editor the way we need to - ie formatting, including embed codes to videos, etc.

fields.description:
I would like to be able to configure time tracking on a project by project basis.  The reason for this is that some teams may want to alter their hours per day to account for project overhead.
For instance:
- One project may want to allow 8 hours per day 
- Another may want to limit it to a 6.5 hour day to account for a 20% administrative overhead.
- Etc.

It would also be useful to allow the other settings to be configured on a per project basis.
fields.summary: I would like to be able to configure time tracking per project

fields.description:
We currently use TeamCity as our continuous integration server.  We would like the ability to integrate Jira with TeamCity similar to the functionality that currently exists between Jira and Bamboo.

Are there any plans to implement similar functionality with Jira and TeamCity?  If there are no current plans to provide this type of integration, then how could we go about writing a plug-in to accomplish this same functionality?

Thank you,

Shawn.
fields.summary: TeamCity / Jira Integration

fields.description:
Using comment permlinks within emails are very ugly due to the long url string

(e.g. http://www.jira.com/jira/browse/OSKAR-5280?focusedCommentId=92642&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Acomment-tabpanel#action_92642)

Please try to generate working permlinks like {{http://www.jira.com/jira/browse/OSKAR-5280?focusedCommentId=92642}} without the class-path.
fields.summary: Generate a shorter and more handsome permlink for JIRA comments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-22517].
  {panel}

How to reproduce:
go to Priorities section in the Administration screen, pick any priority and try to change its attributes.
Then see if this priority is actually changed for any issue.
Nope.

It looks like the cache for priorities is not refreshed by {{com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.priorities.EditPriority}} action.

Known workaround: just reshuffle back and forth the order of priorities after editing any of them (using up and down arrows) and it will refresh the caches used by JIRA.
fields.summary: Editing priorities in admin section and saving it does not have any visible impact on priorities in the system
Error messages (when BAD REQUEST) are not returned as JSON while POSTing to /<issueKey>/transitions"

If user double clicks on "Delete" button when deleting a user, the NullPointerException will be triggered by the 2nd user deleting request and thrown on UI.
{noformat}

at webwork.action.ActionSupport.execute(ActionSupport.java:162)
at com.atlassian.jira.action.JiraActionSupport.execute(JiraActionSupport.java:53)
at webwork.dispatcher.GenericDispatcher.executeAction(GenericDispatcher.java:139)
...
{noformat}

h4. Suggestion:
Disable(grey) "Delete" button after it's clicked.
fields.summary: Throw NullPointerException when double click "Delete" user button

Susan Unger

fields.description:
GreenHopper Burndown Charts get out of sync when editing/deleting worklogs in JIRA.
Workaround for this is to prevent users from editing they own worklog. This is not a good solution and affects lots of users.
fields.summary: Deleting worklogs cause errors in GreenHopper's Burndown Charts

fields.description: When JIRA_HOME is set, all log file paths are rooted under JIRA_HOME/log, even when an absolute path is set for the log file path in log4j.properties.  For instance, JIRA_HOME is set to /data/jira and the path to the atlassian-jira log file is set to /data/jira/logs/atlassian-jira.log in log4j.properties.  The log file ends up in /data/jira/log/data/jira/logs/atlassian-jira.log when it should actually be in /data/jira/logs/atlassian-jira.log.
fields.summary: JIRA log file paths are always rooted under JIRA_HOME if set
Projects should be grouped by category

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-22508].
  {panel}

Logging in flat files is great for standard configurations.

However, when deploying JIRA in large organizations, it's annoying to have a lot of log files to monitor, rotate and backup. Especially when you already have some standard log management processes.

We centralize all logs using the syslog protocol. But in order to send JIRA logs to a syslog server, you currently have to modify a lot of files.
And I let JIRA developpers imagine the mess admins have to deal with when upgrading JIRA... Especially when the logging configuration is updated between releases. ;)

So, when will the admins get a convenient logging feature?
fields.summary: Easier syslog integration

fields.description:
We have several users with the same email address. When we want to filter out a user we have to search on email address today.

We would like the ability to search for users on user name instead.
fields.summary: User Browser should filter on username, not on email address

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-22506].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 23 April 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your input in the comments helps us understand how this affects you and what you're hoping to accomplish with JIRA.

At this time, this suggestion is not on the JIRA development roadmap. Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Regards,
Dave Meyer
[dmeyer@atlassian.com|mailto:dmeyer@atlassian.com]
Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}

Currently you can look for an issue that has been updated in the last 5 days. It would be useful to tie this in with the working days set in Time Tracking to search for issues created in the last 5 working days.
fields.summary: JQL search with working days range

fields.description:
They keyboard shortcut "p" focuses the next comment on the view issue page.

However, the sequence of pressing "g" then "p" is a _global_ shortcut for navigating to the current issue's project screen. Executing a shortcut sequence like this currently does not prevent a single-key shortcut (whose key forms part of this sequence) from also executing. However, it should.

Steps to reproduce:

# Go to the view issue page of an issue that has one or more comments.
# Press "g".
# Press "p".

\\
Result:

Both the "twixi" link of the last comment is focused and the current project page is loaded -- i.e., actions for both "p" and \["g","p"] shortcuts are executed.

Expected result:

The twixi should not be focused, but the current project page should be loaded -- i.e., only the \["g","p"] shortcut should be executed.
fields.summary: Sequenced keyboard shortcuts don't 'mute' other shortcuts assigned to the same key

fields.description:
From SAC it looks like users often assume that the Standalone release can't be used for production installations.

{quote}
I want to have the data running through our (daily backed-up) database.

I quote the following page, which are the exact reasons why I want to connect it to our company's database over using the HQSLDB: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA041/Connecting+JIRA+to+a+Database

"As part of its installation process, JIRA Standalone automatically installs, configures and connects itself to an HSQLDB database. This is fine for evaluation purposes, however HSQLDB is prone to database corruption. For production installations, we strongly recommend that you connect JIRA to an enterprise database. This also lets you take advantage of existing database backup and recovery procedures. "

Can I connect to our MS SQL 2005 DB with the "standalone" JIRA? I was under the impression it could only run HSQLD
{quote}
fields.summary: Misleading statement  re differences between standalone and WAR release

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-22499].
  {panel}

The "principle of least astonishment" http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Principle_of_least_astonishment was violated when I decided to delete an issue link.  

To edit a link?  Why you simply click "view links in more detail".  View != Edit is the violation.

How hard would it be to use Alt Text that goes "edit links or view links in more detail"?

Thanks
fields.summary: Only Way To Delete an Issue Link is to Click Something That Says "View" on it

fields.description: I would personally love to see the feature included in JIRA Studio (http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASTUDIO/Actioning+Issues+via+Commit+Messages) also included in the standalone version. (or have some other way of having one (SVN) commit message action multiple issues..)
fields.summary: Actioning issues via commit messages

fields.description:
We have identified and fixed vulnerabilities in JIRA 4.2 which will allow an attacker to invoke XSS (Cross Site Scripting) attacks and/or Cross Site Request Forgery (XSRF) attacks. Full details of the severity, risks and vulnerabilities can be found in the *[JIRA Security Advisory 2010-11-06|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+Security+Advisory+2010-12-06]*.

The patches below should be applied. Please note that all Studio instances are not vulnerable at the time of this disclosure.

Note these patches are cumulative and include the fixes that were applied in JRA-21004, 
h3. Patches

||Version ||File ||
|3.13.5|[patch-JRA-22493-3.13.5.zip|http://downloads.atlassian.com/software/jira/downloads/patch/patch-JRA-22493-3.13.5-cumulative.zip] |
|4.0.2 |[patch-JRA-22493-4.0.2.zip|http://downloads.atlassian.com/software/jira/downloads/patch/patch-JRA-22493-4.0.2-cumulative.zip] |
|4.1.2 |[patch-JRA-22493-4.1.2.zip|http://downloads.atlassian.com/software/jira/downloads/patch/patch-JRA-22493-4.1.2-cumulative.zip] |
|4.2   |[patch-JRA22493-4.2.zip|http://downloads.atlassian.com/software/jira/downloads/patch/patch-JRA22493-4.2.zip] |
fields.summary: Patches for XSS / XSRF vulnerabilities

fields.description: Please see screenshot.
fields.summary: Keyboard Shortcuts dialog layout differs in IE8 (compared with Safari) [screenshot]

fields.description: the friends instant messaging can be sorted by name. why not sort by date, making it easy to find the last person you talked to.
fields.summary: Sort IM Friends List by Last Message Sent (sort by date)

fields.description:
We classify our users into three levels: restricted, unrestricted, and power users.  I have created a group in JIRA for each of these levels, and granted them different capabilities using the custom permission schemes.  However, all three of these groups need the ability to log into JIRA, so, I have granted them the JURA Users global permission, which is required to log in.

The unfortunate side effect of this is that all new users are granted membership in these groups, and I have to then manually edit the group list for each user to take out the groups they do not need.  Since most of my users are unrestricted, I would prefer to have a way to specify that all new users go in the unrestricted group, and then be able to change them if necessary, rather than having to edit every single user to put them in the correct group.
fields.summary: Default group for new users should not be tied to the JIRA Users permission

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-22487].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

As a user I would like to be able to search and return sub-tasks in the results where the parent issue meets certain criteria. For example:

{code}
parent = CRM-46 AND parent.assignee = mminicki
{code}

h3. Suggested Solution

Provide a JQL function (and API) allowing to search for issues where the sub-task meets certain criteria.
 
h3. Workaround 

There are two current third-party plugins that provide this functionality:

* [Script Runner for JIRA|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.onresolve.jira.groovy.groovyrunner/server/overview], the [subtasksOf()|https://scriptrunner.adaptavist.com/latest/jira/jql-functions.html#_subtasksof] function.
* [J-Tricks|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.j-tricks.jql-plugin/server/overview], the [subtask|http://www.j-tricks.com/jqlt-subtask-functions.html] functions.
fields.summary: As a user I want to be able to search for sub-tasks with parent related conditions

fields.description:
Many of our users use a lot of custom dashboards and some of them have long names so they end up having a lot of truncated dashboard names. We didn't have that problem in previous version of JIRA when the dashboard tabs were on top of the gadgets instead of on the left.

A new feature for users to be able to move the tabs on the top would be much useful and appreciated.
fields.summary: Need a new feature to be able to move the dashboard tabs on top of the gadgets like in previous JIRA versions.

fields.description:
Leaving the default language (Administration > General Configuration > Edit Configuration) set to English, causes the following behavior:

1. As administrator, go to Issue settings, click on Priorities and then Translate
2. Select other language and click View
3. Edit all fields 
4. Click update
5. The screen refreshes back to English and loses all data typed.


When changing the default language to the one that is being edit, the behavior do not persist.

This affect customers that use JIRA with English as Default language, but want to present to users in other loactions  the possibility of setting language to his own.
fields.summary: translate issue types and priorities to other language when English language is selected have no effect

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-22469].
  {panel}

When creating a project with the Plugin SDK (version 3.2) one gets a pom with those dependencies:
{code:xml}
    <dependencies>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>com.atlassian.jira</groupId>
            <artifactId>atlassian-jira</artifactId>
            <version>${jira.version}</version>
            <scope>provided</scope>
        </dependency>        
        <dependency>
            <groupId>junit</groupId>
            <artifactId>junit</artifactId>
            <version>4.6</version>
            <scope>test</scope>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>com.atlassian.jira</groupId>
            <artifactId>jira-func-tests</artifactId>
            <version>${jira.version}</version>
            <scope>test</scope>
        </dependency>
    </dependencies>
{code}

The {{jira.version}} is set to 4.1.2 in this case.

What happens is that when someone uses the servlet API in their, as it is sometimes required by JIRA's own API usage, it doesn't compile. Looking at the dependency tree for the servlet-api make it obvious:

First running:
{noformat}
mvn dependency:tree -Dincludes=*:servlet-api:*:*

[INFO] [dependency:tree]
[INFO] com.atlassian.plugins.tutorial:jira-report-plugin:atlassian-plugin:1.0-SNAPSHOT
[INFO] \- com.atlassian.jira:jira-func-tests:jar:4.1.2:test
[INFO]    \- javax.servlet:servlet-api:jar:2.3:test

{noformat}

It shows that the servlet-api's scope is {{test}}, when one expects it to be {{provided}}. 

{noformat}
mvn dependency:tree -Dincludes=*:servlet-api:*:* -Dverbose

[INFO] [dependency:tree]
[INFO] com.atlassian.plugins.tutorial:jira-report-plugin:atlassian-plugin:1.0-SNAPSHOT
[INFO] +- com.atlassian.jira:atlassian-jira:jar:4.1.2:provided
[INFO] |  +- com.atlassian.ofbiz:atlassian-ofbiz:jar:2.7.3:provided
[INFO] |  |  \- (javax.servlet:servlet-api:jar:2.3:provided - omitted for duplicate)
[INFO] |  +- com.atlassian.plugins:atlassian-plugins-webresource:jar:2.4.4:provided
[INFO] |  |  \- (javax.servlet:servlet-api:jar:2.3:provided - omitted for duplicate)
[INFO] |  +- com.atlassian.security.auth.trustedapps:atlassian-trusted-apps-core:jar:2.1:provided
[INFO] |  |  \- (javax.servlet:servlet-api:jar:2.3:provided - omitted for duplicate)
[INFO] |  +- com.atlassian.gzipfilter:atlassian-gzipfilter:jar:1.9:provided
[INFO] |  |  \- (javax.servlet:servlet-api:jar:2.3:provided - omitted for duplicate)
[INFO] |  +- org.apache.velocity:velocity-tools:jar:1.3:provided
[INFO] |  |  \- (javax.servlet:servlet-api:jar:2.3:provided - omitted for duplicate)
[INFO] |  \- commons-jelly:commons-jelly:jar:1.0:provided
[INFO] |     \- (javax.servlet:servlet-api:jar:2.3:provided - omitted for duplicate)
[INFO] \- com.atlassian.jira:jira-func-tests:jar:4.1.2:test
[INFO]    +- net.sourceforge.jwebunit:jwebunit:jar:1.2-atlassian-1:test
[INFO]    |  \- (javax.servlet:servlet-api:jar:2.3:test - omitted for duplicate)
[INFO]    +- com.meteware.httpunit:httpunit:jar:1.5.4-atlassian-8:test
[INFO]    |  \- (javax.servlet:servlet-api:jar:2.3:test - omitted for duplicate)
[INFO]    \- javax.servlet:servlet-api:jar:2.3:test
{noformat}

This shows that the servler-api is NOT a direct dependency of {{atlassian-jira}} when I believe it should be. This would solve the compilation problem. This is a problem a few plugin developers have had and are puzzled by most of the time.
fields.summary: Explicitly declare the servlet API as a dependency for 'atlassian-jira'

fields.description:
지난달 28일 끝난 노동당 대표자회 이후 북한 당국이 '3대 세습'에 대한 주민들의 비판 여론이 일고 있다고 미국 자유아시아방송(RFA)이 8일 보도했다. 이에 따라 북한 당국은 내부 단속과 선전을 강화하는 것으로 알려졌다.
 
이 매체는 함경북도 청진시의 한 소식통을 인용해 "당대표자회 이후에 김정일과 김정은을 비방하는 삐라가 평성 장마당 부근에 나붙었다는 소문이 돌고 있다"며 "청진시 수남구역에서는 '새끼돼지 어미돼지 모조리 잡아먹자'는 낙서가 발견돼 큰 소동이 벌어졌다"고 전했다.
 
이에 북한 당국은 강연회 등을 통해 내부 단속을 강화하고 있는 것으로 알려졌다. 평안북도 신의주시의 한 소식통은 "강연회에서 '김정일 국방위원장이 노동당 총비서로 추대된 데 대해 미제와 남조선이 극도의 불안을 느끼고 우리(북한) 내부에 불순한 유언비어를 퍼뜨리기 위해 날뛰고 있다'고 전파하는 것을 들었다"고 전했다.
 
청진시 소식통도 "인민반회의에서 '남한 안기부(국정원)의 돈을 받은 반동분자들이 온갖 유언비어를 퍼뜨리고 있어 이들을 잡아내야 한다'는 말이 나왔다"고 방송에 전했다. 
 
북한 당국은 또 비판 여론을 막기 위해 '유언비어를 퍼뜨린 사람을 신고하면 신변을 보장하고 크게 표창한다'고 선전하는 것으로 알려졌다. 이 청진시의 소식통은 "올해 청진시에서만 신고를 열심히 한 주민 5명이 '천연색텔레비전'(컬러TV)를 받았고, 8명은 10만원 이상의 상금을 받았다고 선전하기도 했다"고 말했다.

김진명 "김정일 죽으면 중국이 북한 먹는다"
fields.summary: test

fields.description:
Currently, Excel files generated from Issue Navigator cannot be imported to Google Docs or Office Web Apps, due to conversion issues.

The generated Excel file seems to have non-standard Excel contents (HTML-like contents). Perhaps due to this, conversions may fail, causing [JRA-11255] and in some cases, it displays in OpenOffice Calc as a raw HTML file.
fields.summary: Excel from issue navigator is not importable into Google Docs or Office Web Apps

fields.description:
If an issue does not have any fixVersion assigned, it will not show up in a query that searches for 
{code}
fixVersion NOT IN ("Version1")
{code}

It will also not work for the != operator.

Steps to reproduce:
Create a new issue, don't assign any fix versions. (ISSUE-1)
Create another new issue, assign it only one fix version (eg, 4.2). (ISSUE-2)
Search for: 'project = JRA and fixVersion NOT IN ("4.0.2")' (where JRA, and 4.0.2 are values that make sense for your system).

ISSUE-1 will not turn up in the search, ISSUE-2 will.

The workaround is to add another clause: 
{code}
project = JRA AND (fixVersion NOT IN ("4.0.2") OR fixVersion IS EMPTY)
{code}

The workaround is simple enough, but this behaviour is not intuitive, and most users will assume that the first version of the search should return to them all the issues they care about -- Issues that are not scheduled for version X.
fields.summary: JQL - Negation operators for Versions fields do not handle nulls correctly

fields.description:
If the custom field name has quote (' or "), the wiki preview does not work. If the wiki preview is clicked, the page will jump to the top and the text is not rendered to be viewed.

This is tested to be happening in 3.13.x
fields.summary: Wiki preview does not work if the custom field name has quote

fields.description: 4.2 beta 3. Create 4 issues as shown in the attached screenshots. Note that one issue has two labels AAA, BBB. Whichever direction the labels are sorted in the Issue Navigator, the issue with two labels appears first in the group of issues that have the AAA label. I would expect that reversing a sort would present all the issues in reverse order, which is not the case here.
fields.summary: Sorting by label behaves unexpectedly
Show project category on /secure/project/ViewProjects.jspa

fields.description:
Please please please change {{CommentClauseQueryFactory.generateIssueIdFromCommentQuery()}} to use a DocumentHitCollector rather than a for() loop that iterates over Hits.

We're _still_ working on upgrading our Jira 3.13 to 4.1.2.
One thing I noticed was that comment queries were taking _forever_ on my test server when compared to 3.13 running on the same server.
After a day of debugging and testing, I narrowed it down to looping through the {{Hits}} in {{CommentClauseQueryFactory.generateIssueIdFromCommentQuery()}}.
The Hits class is deprecated and states, {code:java} /** 
 * Iterating over all hits is generally not desirable and may be the source of
 * performance issues. If you need to iterate over many or all hits, consider
 * using the search method that takes a {@link HitCollector}.
 */{code}

I modified our Jira to use a {{com.atlassian.jira.issue.statistics.util.DocumentHitCollector}} instead of a for() loop over Hits and our comment queries are now miraculously 6 to 8 times faster.

Here are the statistics for one of my tests before and after the change. For this test I ran *comment ~ power* which returns about 7000 issues. In Jira 3 I ran the equivalent by putting 'power' into the query box and checking only 'Comments'.
* Before the change
** In Luke, the Lucene query took 3.5 seconds (and without the level restrictions it took 389 ms, which one should consider for another Improvement....)
** In Jira, the Lucene query took the same amount time
** Looping through the issue id's took 74 seconds
* After the change
** Lucene query with hit collection takes 12s
fields.summary: Comment Query Performance: Please Change CommentClauseQueryFactory.generateIssueIdFromCommentQuery from for loop to HitCollector

fields.description:
Hello,

When an issue is resolved or closed, if you mention / link this issue in another issue (on comments, "Free Text" custom fields, etc), it writes the link with a strike, and the font is Times New Roman instead of Arial.
In the image "JRA-7" attached, you can see that "JRA-5" is being mentioned in the comments and in a "Free Text" custom field.
In the image "JRA-5" attached, you can see that the issue status is "Resolved".
"JRA-2" mentioned in "JRA-7" image is closed, and it was showing wrong font also... I could not reproduce again to show you, but I'm sure of that.

This issue happens in IE8. It does not happen in Firefox.
(It happens in IE6 also, but IE6 is deprecated, that's why I didn't mention it on the summary or environment)

Please let me know if you need further explanation.

Regards,
____________________
Felipe Kraemer
Atlassian Support
fields.summary: IE8 displaying different font on links for resolved / closed issues

fields.description:
Hello,

This improvement should be interesting, in a way to make JIRA work much like some banking sites, that don't have the autocomplete password setting on, regardless of the browser setting. 

Also, this should be changeable via admin section, so lower risk instances can benefit from autocomplete, but this shouldn't stop high risk instances from getting this.

Regards
Thiago Prisco
Atlassian Support
fields.summary: Change the autocomplete setting regardless of browser

fields.description:
Is it possible to get an alternate 500page.jsp, which does not divulge so much information regarding the server set-up.
Whilst the information is useful to help with diagnosing errors which occur, it is also very useful for an attacker visiting the site.
fields.summary: Alternate 500page.jsp which does not divulge so much information regarding the server set-up

fields.description:
This issue happens whether I use a saved filter or whether I use an implicit filter (such as clicking on the "Outstanding" link on the project overview screen).

When I am viewing the results of a filter, I can view an individual item, and at the upper right of the screen there is a little section that looks like this:

Return to search
Issue 1 of 54 issue(s)
<< Previous | NP-97 | Next >> 

If I do any kind of operation on the issue, however, such as logging work to it or assigning it to someone, the saved filter somehow changes to "all issues":

Return to search
Issue 14310 of 20284 issue(s)
<< Previous | NP-97 | Next >> 

This is a rather odd behavior, and not one I've seen before.  The strange thing is that I don't think we've upgraded JIRA in a while, so I'm not sure if it's related to the size of the issue database or something.
fields.summary: Return to Search loses filter when an issue is operated on

fields.description:
When setting a versions value and fixVersions value in the CreateIssue element, the issue is created without these values being set. The project here is a newly created Project with all default values. Attaching a screenshot of the resulting issue with the versions value as blank

{panel}
<JiraJelly xmlns:jira="jelly:com.atlassian.jira.jelly.enterprise.JiraTagLib"><jira:Login username="admin" password="admin">

<jira:AddVersion xmlns="jelly:com.atlassian.jira.jelly.enterprise.JiraTagLib" project-key="JTEST" name="2.0 alpha"/>

<jira:CreateIssue xmlns="jelly:com.atlassian.jira.jelly.enterprise.JiraTagLib" versions="2.0 alpha" summary="Affects Version TEST" reporter="admin" project-key="JTEST" priority="Blocker" issueType="Bug" issueKeyVar="key" fixVersions="2.0 alpha" assignee="-1"/>
</jira:Login>
</JiraJelly>
{panel}
fields.summary: Jelly CreateIssue not setting Affects Version and FixVersion
